text: This might be specific to julia or atom but I was working on a file and all of a sudden everything disappeared from my file. It looks blank. If I click on undo it still remains blank. Did I somehow hide the code?

elements.text: This might be specific to julia or atom but I was working on a file and all of a sudden everything disappeared from my file. It looks blank. If I click on undo it still remains blank. Did I somehow hide the code?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
Sounds like some issue with your editor/IDE to me. But even then `Ctrl + Z` (or whatever equivalent you might use) should do the trick hmm...

elements.text: Sounds like some issue with your editor/IDE to me. But even then

text:
<@U01JRP2P1DY> <@U01QRM4E8HL> Well I've been able to reproduce the same issue several times now today and it happens randomly. Thankfully these past few times it has not completely eliminated all rows. So in a 100 line file it will just leave me with like 10 lines.
When that happens what I'm doing is saving as a new file name. Once I do that, the new saved file remains defective but the original once reopened works fine with all data still there.

elements.text:
Well I've been able to reproduce the same issue several times now today and it happens randomly. Thankfully these past few times it has not completely eliminated all rows. So in a 100 line file it will just leave me with like 10 lines.
When that happens what I'm doing is saving as a new file name. Once I do that, the new saved file remains defective but the original once reopened works fine with all data still there.

text: I'm abandoning atom and going to vscode for the time being

elements.text: I'm abandoning atom and going to vscode for the time being
